intro: Seridia glomerata, commonly known as the clustered seridia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers arranged in dense clusters, giving it its common name. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Seridia glomerata is often found in grasslands and along coastal areas, where it thrives in full sunlight.
